{{cpp/title|ispunct}}
{{cpp/string/byte/navbar}}
{{ddcl|header=cctype|
int ispunct( int ch );
}}

Checks if the given character is a punctuation character as classified by the current C locale. The default C locale classifies the characters ({{tt|1=!"#$%&amp;'()*+,-./:;&lt;=&gt;?@[\]^_`{&lt;!----&gt;{{!}}&lt;!----&gt;}~}}) as punctuation.

The behavior is undefined if the value of {{c|ch}} is not representable as {{c/core|unsigned char}} and is not equal to {{c|EOF}}.

===Parameters===
{{par begin}}
{{par|ch|character to classify}}
{{par end}}

===Return value===
Non-zero value if the character is a punctuation character, zero otherwise.

===Notes===
{{cpp/string/byte/note unsigned char}}

===Example===
{{example|
|code=
#include &lt;cctype&gt;
#include &lt;clocale&gt;
#include &lt;iostream&gt;

int main()
{
    unsigned char c = '\xd7'; // the character Ã— (multiplication sign) in ISO-8859-1

    std::cout &lt;&lt; "ispunct(\'\\xd7\', default C locale) returned "
              &lt;&lt; std::boolalpha &lt;&lt; (bool)std::ispunct(c) &lt;&lt; '\n';

    std::setlocale(LC_ALL, "en_GB.iso88591");
    std::cout &lt;&lt; "ispunct(\'\\xd7\', ISO-8859-1 locale) returned "
              &lt;&lt; std::boolalpha &lt;&lt; (bool)std::ispunct(c) &lt;&lt; '\n';
}
|p=true
|output=
ispunct('\xd7', default C locale) returned false
ispunct('\xd7', ISO-8859-1 locale) returned true
}}
